feature.name: Otherworldly Patron: Pact of the Eternal Intern (HB)
feature.text:
The Pact of the Eternal Intern Warlock channels the unyielding spirit of the underappreciated aide, transforming menial tasks into potent magical feats. With every brewed potion of caffeinated concoction, they gain clairvoyant foresight, preparing them for the tumults of battle and bureaucracy alike.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 17 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Expanded Spell List (Pact of the Eternal Intern (HB))
feature.text:
The Eternal Intern lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.
The Eternal Intern Expanded Spells: Spell Level | Spells 1st | bane, Tasha's hideous laughter 2nd | blur, pass without trace 3rd | haste, Leomund's tiny hut 4th | compulsion, Mordenkainen's private sanctum 5th | geas, planar binding
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 17 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Unyielding Focus (Pact of the Eternal Intern (HB))
feature.text:
At 1st level, your pact enhances your mental resilience, granting you advantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain your concentration on a spell.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 17 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Caffeinated Concoction (Pact of the Eternal Intern (HB))
feature.text:
You gain the ability to brew cups of magical coffee equal to your Charisma modifier, as part of a short or long rest. Drinking this coffee grants you or any ally temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier. As the Intern, you can drink a second cup of coffee, gaining advantage on your next initiative roll. This coffee loses its taste and effectiveness after 1 hour.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 17 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Employee Benefits (Pact of the Eternal Intern (HB))
feature.text:
At 6th level, your patron provides you with a choice of benefits for your diligent service. While concentrating on a spell, you can choose one of the following benefits to apply for the duration of the concentration.
Supernatural Stamina. You have resistance to one type of damage of your choice.
Eldritch Focus. You gain a bonus of +2 to AC and saving throws.
Task Mastery. You can add your Charisma modifier to skill checks.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 17 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Overtime (Pact of the Eternal Intern (HB))
feature.text:
At 10th level, when a spell that requires concentration is about to end, you can cast it again without spending a spell slot as an action. When you use this feature, you can keep your previous Employee Benefit(s) while adding a new one that both last until the end of the new spells concentration. Once you use this feature, you must take a long rest to use it again.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 17 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Spectral Assistant (Pact of the Eternal Intern (HB))
feature.text:
At 14th level, upon casting a spell that requires concentration, you can summon a spectral assistant to maintain concentration on it for you. The assistant stays within 5 feet of you, moves with you, and must make concentration saving throws when attacked, and is destroyed upon failing, at which point you regain the expended spell slot. Once you use this feature, you must take a long rest to use it again.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 17 (Homebrew)
